intro: Sabatia paniculata var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandplain bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which are often borne on long, slender peduncles. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dunes. This variant is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other varieties of Sabatia paniculata.
